alert.note: Alert for Eastern Franklin; Western Franklin; Western Hampshire (Massachusetts) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 07 at 5:42PM EDT by NWS Boston
info.description: ...A slow moving strong thunderstorm will impact portions of far northwestern Hampshire and central Franklin Counties through 630 PM EDT... At 541 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Ashfield, or 10 miles southwest of Greenfield, moving east at 10 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and pea size hail. Torrential rainfall can be expected. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Strong winds could cause minor damage such as downed branches. Little to no impact from hail is expected. Heavy rain may cause localized, minor flooding. Locations impacted include... Greenfield, Deerfield, Montague, Sunderland, Williamsburg, Bernardston, Buckland, Conway, Shelburne, Leverett, Ashfield, Colrain, Gill, Whately, Charlemont, Worthington, Goshen, Cummington, Leyden and Heath. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: Get indoors when you hear thunder. Do not resume outdoor activities until at least 30 minutes after the storm has passed.
